instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no camera" after screen replacement.
threads.message:
I have seen this problem on air boards so I figured it was just the 5v missing.   It wasn't.
so I diode tested against my reference board L8502 and L8503.   Readings were a little high compared to my reference board.   .7   instead of .5 so I replaced <CHIP>U8502</CHIP> and that didn't work.

Just to be sure I checked a known good display and still no camera.   It does not even find the camera.  

Question?
so my T2 is toast?  How do I verify from here?  Junk it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no camera" after screen replacement.
threads.message:
ALS works at least?
Did you check the components from camera data lines?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  "no camera" after screen replacement.
threads.message:
I did.  No physical signs of damage.   Passives are all good.   No water damage. 
I probably need to put a scope on it.   <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> I am sure is bad.   I wish we could change these
